text:
Think I got my build environments messed up by Ctrl-C'ing at the wrong time. First I got `*┌ Warning:* TerminalMenus: Unable to enter raw mode: Base.IOError("stream is closed or unusable", 0)` 
`*└* @ REPL.TerminalMenus /buildworker/worker/package_linux64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.6/REPL/src/TerminalMenus/AbstractMenu.jl:195`

followed by an EOFError. Then when starting a new run_wizard I got `ArgumentError: '/tmp/jl_rXgoUR/1uf7Sz8T/srcdir' exists. `force=true` is required to remove '/tmp/jl_rXgoUR/1uf7Sz8T/srcdir' before copying.`
opening the build env

is that with the wizard?
Yes

text: my solution would be to not use the wizard :stuck_out_tongue:

elements.text: my solution would be to not use the wizard

text: But mr. wizard is so kind (mostly) to me :cry:. The rabbit hole grows deeper

text: honestly I've never seen that error, so I'm not sure what to do about that :confused:

text: It's probably not something to worry about, I just interrupted it in a weird spot probably

text:
pro tip: to completely reset the wizard state, do
```BinaryBuilder.Wizard.save_wizard_state(BinaryBuilder.Wizard.WizardState())```

elements.text: pro tip: to completely reset the wizard state, do
BinaryBuilder.Wizard.save_wizard_state(BinaryBuilder.Wizard.WizardState())

text:
also, if you really want to use the wizard, I recommend doing
```state = BinaryBuilder.run_wizard()```
which is nice because it's occasionally useful to have the `state` variable to refer to (as also suggested in <https://docs.binarybuilder.org/latest/#Wizard-interface>)
